contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Album | <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> Name = Outa Hand | Type = [[Album]] | Artist = [[Coney Hatch]] | Cover = Outtahand.JPG | Released = 1983 | Recorded = | Genre = [[Rock music|Rock]] | Length = | Label = [[Anthem]] | Producer = [[Max Norman]] | Last album = ''[[Coney Hatch (album)|Coney Hatch]]''<br />(1982) | This album = '''''Outa Hand'''''<br />(1983) | Next album = ''[[Friction (Coney Hatch album)|Friction]]''<br />(1983) | }} {{Album ratings | rev1 = [[Allmusic]] | rev1Score = {{Rating|2|5}} [{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r33773|pure_url=yes}} link] | noprose = yes }} '''''Outa Hand''''', the second album by [[Coney Hatch]], was released in 1983. == Musicians == *[[Carl Dixon]] – rhythm guitar, lead vocals *Andy Curran – bass guitar, lead vocals * *Steve Shelski – lead guitar, vocals *Dave "Thumper" Ketchum – drums, percussion Max Norman produced Y&T's 1982 album '''Black Tiger'''. As well as a string of Megadeth, and Loudness albums. ==Track listing== # 4:16 - Don't Say Make Me # 3:32 - Shake It * # 3:48 - First Time For Everything # 2:56 - Some Like It Hot * # 4:13 - To Feel The Feeling Again # 3:57 - Too Far Gone # 3:33 - Love Games * # 3:27 - Fallen Angel * # 5:41 - Music Of The Night # 3:01 - Nobody Gives You [bonus track on 2006 remastered CD] # 3:29 - Your Kinda Love [bonus track on 2006 remastered CD] * # 4:18 - Fly On (demo) [bonus track on 2006 remastered CD] [[Category:1983 albums]] [[Category:Coney Hatch albums]] [[Category:Albums produced by Max Norman]] {{1980s-rock-album-stub}}
